title: Trump's Effort to Narrow the Trade Gap Has Flopped So Far
summary: The president's tax policies are as much in play as tariffs. President Trump set his sights on reducing mammoth U.S. trade deficits. In the coming week, the Census Bureau will likely report the U.S. last year registered the largest trade deficit in its history.

title: Trump Says He Was in a 'Horrible Position' Over Otto Warmbier Situation
summary: Parents of tortured student blamed Kim regime after president said he accepted North Korean leader's word that he didn't know about abuse. President Trump on Saturday lamented his "horrible position" of negotiating with North Korea following the death of Otto Warmbier, after the president drew criticism for saying that he accepted Kim Jong Un's word that he didn't know about Mr. Warmbier's abuse in Pyongyang's captivity.

title: Children's Place and Gap Winners of Gymboree Auction
summary: Bankrupt children's clothing retailer finds buyers for Janie and Jack chain, namesake and Crazy 8 brands. Children's Place Inc. is buying the brand name of children's clothing retailer Gymboree Group, and Gap Inc. is purchasing the bankrupt retailer's Janie and Jack chain following a bankruptcy-court auction.

title: The Free-Form Funeral
summary: Resume Subscription. There are new ways to say goodbye.

title: How Canada Goosed the Currency Market
summary: A surprise early release of unexpectedly weak GDP data put Canada in a rare spotlight. Oh, Canada!

title: EBay Settles, More or Less
summary: Activist settlement may mean goodbye for some of eBay's valuables. EBay isn't necessarily for sale, but parts of it could be soon.

title: In the South, New Monuments Look to Honor Victims of Lynching
summary: Markers gain approval as fate of some Confederate monuments remains stalled by political or legal fights.

title: U.S. Allies Battle to Oust Islamic State From Final Syrian Outpost
summary: The Syrian Democratic Forces expect a tough battle against several hundred fighters who have refused to surrender. ERBIL, Iraq-U.S.-backed forces have resumed their assault to capture Islamic State's last patch of territory in eastern Syria, ending a truce that allowed for an evacuation before an intense final battle.

title: Art Collectors Seek Clues to Market Strength at London Sales, New York Fair
summary: Bidders are being selective, market-watchers say; 'They want the right examples by the right names-and at the right estimates,' says one dealer. The art market can be frustratingly opaque, but a series of telltale events-including auctions ongoing in London and a major art fair opening Thursday in New York-could help forecast the trajectory of art prices this year.

title: Cellphone Carriers Dream of World Without Wi-Fi
summary: Verizon calls Wi-Fi 'rubbish,' but providers say it is cheaper and 'getting smarter'. Cellphone companies can't quit Wi-Fi just yet, though not for lack of trying. Cheap and unburdened by regulations governing mobile-phone service, Wi-Fi networks have grown from a coffee-shop perk to near ubiquity. There will be more than 549 million global public and cable company-run hot spots by 2022, contributing to a technology that accounts for more than half of all internet traffic, according to equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc.

title: Tech's Costly Health Benefits Pay Dividends
summary: Including social factors in investment analysis improves returns, data shows. Tech companies that don't yet turn a profit are doling out benefit packages worth over $100,000 per employee. According to their investors, this is good for their bottom lines, not just their consciences.

title: Companies Give a Peek at Life After Libor
summary: Interest-rate benchmark set to expire at the end of 2021; companies begin disclosing risks linked to transition. Corporate finance teams are rifling through loans, investments and derivatives to assess the potential fallout from moving to a new benchmark for short-term borrowing costs.

title: It's Like a Triathlon for People Who Dislike Swimming
summary: An athlete turned off by the aquatic portion of the triathlon finds his groove with the duathlon, a race with only running and biking. The triathlon would be a lot more fun if you didn't have to get wet.

title: Italy Allows Illegal Homes to Be Rebuilt, Earthquake Zone or Not
summary: The government was supposed to crack down, but it has bowed to local pressure to grant amnesty. CASAMICCIOLA TERME, Italy-Angelo Croce was playing in a table-soccer tournament in this village on the island of Ischia when the ground began to shake violently. He ran home in a panic.

title: SpaceX Capsule Lifts Off for Long-Delayed Test Flight
summary: Mission intends to demonstrate readiness for flying U.S. astronauts into orbit later this year. Elon Musk's SpaceX successfully launched a Crew Dragon capsule on its maiden voyage into orbit without people on board, but technical challenges could delay for months the first trip carrying astronauts.

title: Help, We're Drowning in Recycling! Cue the 'Internet of Trash'
summary: Tech won't solve our garbage problem, but it's at least a start.

title: The MetroCard Derailed the Price of a Slice-at Least That's One Theory
summary: The MTA voted against raising the base subway rate, but that may mean little when it comes to what's in store for a piece of pizza. The "Pizza Principle" no longer applies in New York.

title: The Problem for Small-Town Banks: People Want High-Tech Services
summary: Resume Subscription. After the National Bank of Delaware County, a small community bank, bought Bank of America Corp.'s only branch in an upstate New York town, it didn't take long for things to go south.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Accusations Undermine Clean Image Trudeau Crafted
summary: Prime minister, who denies wrongdoing, promised a government with more transparency. OTTAWA-Prime Minister Justin Trudeau came into office in 2015 promising a new era in Canadian politics, with a vow of greater transparency, more freedom for ministers to craft policy, and a stronger voice for women and indigenous people in his government.

title: Even Before Trump and Kim Met, Nuclear Talks Had Run Aground
summary: A U.S. team working ahead of the nuclear talks in Hanoi found North Korea wasn't willing to budge, expecting far more than they were prepared to give. HANOI-Weeks before President Trump journeyed to Vietnam for his second summit with North Korea's Kim Jong Un, there were unmistakable signs the historic meeting might not yield an agreement.

title: Luxury Real-Estate Firm Concierge Auctions Fights Allegations of Fraudulent Bids
summary: A fast-growing force in the business of selling pricey properties, the company is accused of drumming up fake bidders.. In the competitive world of luxury real estate, Concierge Auctions is the dominant force in the rapidly growing business of selling pricey properties to the highest bidder. Billing itself as the leading marketplace for the world's most distinguished properties, Concierge in just 10 years has attracted clients like former basketball star Michael Jordan, advisers like real estate maven Barbara Corcoran and partnerships with Sotheby's International Realty and Engel & Völkers, two of the world's most prestigious real-estate brokerage firms.

title: New HBO Drama Could Have Sad Twist
summary: AT&T risks squandering some of the Time Warner talent it needs to succeed in media. By some measures, it might be said that this was the week that AT&T finally cemented its hold over Time Warner, the media company it acquired last summer for around $81 billion. First, the telephone company prevailed against the Justice Department, whose appeal to block the deal was defeated in court a second time. Then, days later, two of Time Warner's longtime media executives, Richard Plepler of HBO and David Levy of Turner, resigned.

title: For AT&T, No More Fiefdoms at HBO, Warner Bros., Turner
summary: More shake-ups expected at WarnerMedia as Chief Executive John Stankey seeks consolidation. AT&T Inc. closed on its $80 billion-plus acquisition of Time Warner Inc. last June, but the real takeover is beginning now.

title: The Plot Against Low-Income Students
summary: Robert Shireman sold Cuomo on a plan to kill for-profit schools.. Robert Shireman was caught during the Obama Administration playing footsie with a short-seller betting against for-profit colleges. We lost track of him, but he was recently spotted in Albany canoodling with New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo to kill for-profit colleges in the state.

title: Jay Inslee's Climate Infomercial
summary: Washington's Governor will run in 2020 on ideas his own state rejected.. You've heard of single-issue voters, but how about a single-issue candidate? Jay Inslee, the Democratic Governor of Washington state, said Friday he's running for President "because I'm the only candidate who will make defeating climate change our nation's No. 1 priority." As a sign of seriousness, the announcement video ends with a cameo from Bill Nye.

title: Amazon to Launch New Grocery Chain
summary: First outlet could open later this year; chain would be distinct from company's Whole Foods unit. Amazon.com Inc. is planning to open dozens of grocery stores in several major U.S. cities, according to people familiar with the matter, as the retail giant looks to broaden its reach in the food business and touch more aspects of consumers' lives.

title: Canada Allows Extradition of Huawei Executive to Proceed
summary: Decision comes in response to request from U.S. in late January. OTTAWA-Canada said Friday the U.S. had presented enough evidence to proceed with the extradition hearing for a Huawei Technologies Co. top executive, clearing the way for a case at the center of tensions between the U.S., China and Canada.

title: Trump vs. a Republican Senate
summary: The national emergency vote could hurt GOP incumbents in 2020.. President Trump's immigration misfires hurt his own party in the midterms, and now he looks poised to inflict more damage for 2020. Congress is rebelling against Mr. Trump's decision to declare a national emergency to build a border wall, though the President will win this battle with a veto. But Republicans in Congress could be collateral damage.

title: Lyft's IPO Filing Offers Look at Size, Scope of Ride-Hailing Company
summary: The smaller rival of Uber showed expanding losses and growing revenue in newly-disclosed papers. Lyft Inc. made its IPO papers public Friday, a move that fires the starting gun on what is expected to be one of the biggest years ever for initial public offerings.
